title: A1990 820-01814-01 No power (5V on ampmetter)
message:
Hello, I have an A1990 that has no power. It only pulls 5V from charger.
On PP20V_USBC_XA_VBUS it only has 5V on F3000.
Can you help me?

title: A1990 820-01814-01 No power (5V on ampmetter)
message:
Do you get 5V on all ports?
PPBUS_G3H is first voltage to get on T2 boards.
Check for short, or low value in diode mode.

title: A1990 820-01814-01 No power (5V on ampmetter)
message:
Hi,
yes, i do have 5V on all ports, and  PPBUS_G3H  = 0V, and it's shorted (0.0029V in diode mode)

title: A1990 820-01814-01 No power (5V on ampmetter)
message:
Switch to ohm mode and compare reading with the values on all big coils.

Do NOT inject voltage yet!

title: A1990 820-01814-01 No power (5V on ampmetter)
message:
Hi, Thanks.

All big coils seams to have the right values. Shell i inject voltage to see what gest's hot?

title: A1990 820-01814-01 No power (5V on ampmetter)
message: Post exact ohm value to ground (not diode mode) on PPBUS_G3H first.

title: A1990 820-01814-01 No power (5V on ampmetter)
message: PPBUS_G3H has 1.55 ohm to ground.

title: A1990 820-01814-01 No power (5V on ampmetter)
message: And CPU coils are not close to that ohm value???

title: A1990 820-01814-01 No power (5V on ampmetter)
message:
Sorry, they are.
They're 2 ohm to ground

title: A1990 820-01814-01 No power (5V on ampmetter)
message:
Unfortunatelly, you didn't bother to specify which coils exactly.
Supposing the problem is on VCORE, remove U7410/20/30 one by one and check when the short disappears from PPBUS_G3H.
If still there, your problem is on iGPU coils; do the same there, if needed.

title: A1990 820-01814-01 No power (5V on ampmetter)
message:
Sorry, it was not my intention to ignore your request
They are all the same:
LA430 = 1.37 ohm on PPVCORE_S0_GFX_PH3
LA640 = 1.35 ohm on PPVCORE_S0_GFX_PH2
LA650 = 1.36 ohm on PPVCORE_S0_GFX_PH1


L7231 = 2 ohm
L7221 = 2 ohm
L7211 = 2 ohm
L7330 = 24 ohm
L7420 = 5.5 ohm
L7410 = 5.5 ohm
LA300 = 174 ohm
LA350 = 28 ohm

Shel i  remove U7410/20/30 ?

title: A1990 820-01814-01 No power (5V on ampmetter)
message:
NO, as you have 5 ohm there.
U7210/20/30 must be checked.

My mistake in previous post; typed 74 instead of 72...

title: A1990 820-01814-01 No power (5V on ampmetter)
message: I don't get any voltages on U7210. Should i remove it?

title: A1990 820-01814-01 No power (5V on ampmetter)
message:
You said to have short on PPBUS_G3H.
Did you apply power on the board again in this condition???

I said to remove chips one by one, and check every time resistance to ground at PPBUS_G3H.

title: A1990 820-01814-01 No power (5V on ampmetter)
message:
Sorry, i miss understood.
I' going to do as you said.

title: A1990 820-01814-01 No power (5V on ampmetter)
message: Hi, i've removed U7210/20/30 and the short persist on PPBUS_G3H (1.60 ohm to ground)

title: A1990 820-01814-01 No power (5V on ampmetter)
message: Now try removing the chips corresponding to VCORE_S0_GFX lines (one by one).

title: A1990 820-01814-01 No power (5V on ampmetter)
message: Sorry, but by chips you're meaning QA340/640/650, or the UA340 / UA600?

title: A1990 820-01814-01 No power (5V on ampmetter)
message:
"LA430 = 1.37 ohm on PPVCORE_S0_GFX_PH3
LA640 = 1.35 ohm on PPVCORE_S0_GFX_PH2
LA650 = 1.36 ohm on PPVCORE_S0_GFX_PH1"
Check associated chips...

title: A1990 820-01814-01 No power (5V on ampmetter)
message:
Hi, i´m a newbie on this, so i ask you to be patient with me :) 
I've removed the QA340, but still have 1.22 ohm on LA340, and don't know to go from here.
i suppose that, if all 3 phases are shorted, they should have a common point between all of them that is causing the short, but i can't find it. Am i rigth?

title: A1990 820-01814-01 No power (5V on ampmetter)
message:
I said to check when the short disappears from PPBUS_G3H!!!
You will always have very low values on these coils as normal.

title: A1990 820-01814-01 No power (5V on ampmetter)
message:
Thanks. We made it :-)
It was a cap on PPBUS_G3H_SSD0_SNS
Thank you.
